title: A person sells an article at 10% below its cost price. Had he sold it for Rs. 332 more, he would have made a profit of 20%. What is the original selling price of the article (Approx.)? - Play with maths - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price of an article is ₹ x, its original selling price (10% below its cost price)= x.(1–10/100) = ₹ 9x/10……………(1). New selling price = ₹ (9x/10 +332). then profit is 20%. S.P.= C.P.(1+r/100). ( 9x/10+332) = x.(1+20/100). or, 332 = 6x/5 - 9x/10. or, 332 = 3x/10. or, x = 3320/3 . Thus , original selling price = ₹ 9x/10 = ₹ 9.(3320/3)/10.= ₹ 996. Answer.

Let cost price be x , so selling price is .9x, new sales price is .9x+332 which is equal to 1.2 x also. Hence .9x+332=1.2x or .3x =332 or x=332/.3 so original selling price is =332*.9/.3=332*3=996 Rs.
